message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR 

The paper proposes a new algorithm for zero-shot learning in image classification, which involves using semantic information to classify images belonging to unseen classes. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The algorithm involves using dictionaries to represent the visual and semantic features of an image, which is a common technique in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of benchmark datasets, which is a common practice in multimedia (cs.MM) and information retrieval (cs.IR) research.
